pages.text: You kill monsters, you take their loot. You need more loot, you kill more monsters. You need even more, ... you get tired of the killing and setup a farm instead. Various mods offer functionality needed to spawn and kill monsters.

pages.title: Woot
pages.text: If you wish to have a spawner that is easy to setup, low in maintenance and friendly for the server, you can setup a $(l:mods/woot)Woot$() monster factory. These factories also integrate with $(l:mods/bloodmagic)Blood Magic$() to generate Life essence.

pages.title: Industrial Foregoing
pages.text: The $(item)Mob Duplicator$() is capable of spawning a monster by placing a trapped monster (in a $(item)Mob Imprisonment Tool$()) in the Duplicator and providing it with Essence and power.$(p)The spawned mobs can then be killed using a $(item)Mob Slaughter Factory$(). A source of Essence is needed in this case, for which a dark room can be helpful.

pages.title: Ender IO
pages.text: The $(item)Powered Spawner$() is also able to spawn monsters of a given type by combining a $(item)Broken Spawner$() with a crafted $(item)Powered Spawner$(). $(item)Broken Spawners$() are obtained by breaking vanilla spawners. Spawn type can then be changed using a filled $(item)Soul Vial$() in a $(item)Soul Binder$(). A $(item)Killer Joe$() can then be setup to kill the monsters. This will also drop XP.

pages.title: Dark Utilities
pages.text: Though not really a mob spawner, the $(item)Monolith of Spawning$() will increase spawn rates for a given chunk. In combination with a dark room setup, this can help to generate random loot and experience quickly, in combination with a mob trab or one of the killing machines of the other mods.

pages.title: RF Tools
pages.text: The RF Tools $(item)Spawner$() provides yet another way to spawn monsters. This requires a $(item)Syringe$() with blood from the appropriate monster type. Place a filled syringe in a Spawner and supply it with power. Additional items must then be supplied through $(item)Matter Beamers$() before the monsters can be spawn.

pages.title: Extra Utilities 2
pages.text: Similar to the $(item)Monolith of Spawning$(), it is also possible to create $(item)Cursed Earth$() by right-clicking regular dirt with a $(item)Drop of Evil$(). These drop from $(thing)Wither Skeletons$() with a drop rate of 10%. $(item)Drops of Evil$() can also be applied on spawners to turn them into $(item)Resturbed Spawners$(), which can be picked up and placed anywhere. (mining a $(item)Resturbed Spawner$() with a pickaxe can be used to pick up the spawner again)

Extra Utilities also has Spikes that can be used on the killing end of the mob farm. Different levels of spikes will have different effects: a $(item)Wooden Spike$() will damage a monster to half a heart (making it easy to finish off by hand), $(item)Stone Spikes$() and $(item)Iron Spikes$() will damage mobs until death, $(item)Gold Spikes$() will also drop XP and $(item)Diamond Spikes$() will even drop loot that is normally only obtainable if the monster is killed by the player.
